item.description:
This is a 2-part Event, come for part 1, part 2, or both!

Part 1: Come hear what may be professional pianist/NHCer Alexis' hottest music of the year, a free concert with professional violinist Mark Rike (you may have heard him at the Obama benefit), featuring pieces by Bach, Mozart, and a blockbuster piece by that Commie Stravinsky. 2pm at Neighborhood Music School.

The music: Bach - Sonata in E Major, BWV 1016; Mozart - Sonata in G, K. 379; Stravinsky - Divertimento

Part 2: After the concert, at approximately 3:30, we will head next door to the Creative Arts Workshop, a terrific arts education center, where they will be having their excellent, ongoing holiday season crafts sale & exhibition (start your holiday shopping!). Also, this 1 day only, they are having their annual Bowl-A-Thon to raise funds to benefit the Community Soup Kitchen. Donate at least $15 and receive a hand-made bowl or mug (that you keep!) of soup with fresh baked bread (you don't have to give back the food either...ewww!) (lower & higher price levels exist too). Such a deal! Food donated by local merchants, including Anny Liffey's and Edge of the Woods.

If you want even more of Creative Arts, the crafts start at 1 and the food at 1:30, so you can show-up before the concert if you like, then come back again after the concert.

The Creative Arts activities end at 5 (but you can always catch their holiday sale on another day).

Part 3?: Who knows, after Creative Arts will we still be hanging-out doing something? Time will tell. Hmmm, what's playing at Criterion?

HOST: Alexis, cell 203-747-9203 (texting ok too). However she will be unreachable for a while before the concert, as she'll be busy warming-up for it. For directions or parking info you can call the venue, Neighborhood Music School, 203-624-5189. You can also call Jason, 203-901-4957 (texting ok too).

You can hear Alexis playing some Mozart at her site:
www.myspace.com/alexiszingalepianist

DIRECTIONS: For directions, click here
item.name: Sun. 11/23 - Hot white Russian + crafts sale + feed-the-hungry!
